name: Live City
description: By Dumbo I was born in 1976 in Milano, Italy, the first son of a working class family; one that was desperately trying to reach the middle class.  Far from interested in video games, horror movies, scooters, religion, or pornography; unlike the other kids my age; I found myself in vandalism at the age of 12/13. I took my inspiration from record covers:  the Ramones and the Ultra Magnetic MCs. What fascinated me right away about graffiti was how, with few resources, you could conquer the attention of many people:  a spray can or a rock to scratch the glass could make people talk about you…fantastic! Now, at 31, I still want people talking about me.  While I writing less, my statements have become all the more provocative. Now behind me, aside from a crooked back from scoliosis and slouching, I have had exhibitions, trouble with the law, debts, the mayor of Milan that won’t leave me alone, a sizable fan club, my friend Lele Saveri that follows me everywhere taking pictures of all I do and a book (DUMBO: Acts of Vandalism and Stories of Love). While in front of me, aside from many confused ideas about what is truly good in this life, I have all of my new projects to show you as soon as I have the chance. I met DB at a stoop sale he was doing.  I stopped to look through all the used and new cds that he was selling. And then we started a conversation…...Are you a musician? My answer was confused: No… I’m a vandal, I mean, I was a vandal; that was my job until my son was born…wait, I still do vandalism but in a different way…but that’s another story, forget it. And then the conversation moved more into art and we discovered that the same person who wrote the preface of my book had sold him 5 or 6 painted bottles. I bought 3 cds from him for 6 dollars, 2 new and 1 used. Hey, I love music. Dumbo’s new book can be found at Amazon

name: Praying Cow
description: by Norik Between connecting with his scandinavian roots via lutefisk, compulsively checking his Facebook, and playing Mortal Kombat, Norik enjoys adorning people’s torsos with silkscreened mutant cows and rosaries. Apparel design is not Norik’s only fancy. He also enjoys contributing his design abilities to hip music & culture brands, as well as finding a niche in making electronic beats, more specifically drum & bass, which has led to a couple claims to fame in Knowledge magazine and a track signing on Covert Operations. It was also through that very music genre he met DB, everything just fit like legos. Through their twisted ideas, and love of the “weird” and “street”, BBS Gear was born. The Norik

name: Famine Field
description: by Jason Clay Lewis Jason Clay Lewis came to New York in 1991 on a scholarship and internship at Universal Limited Art Editions.  From 1992 – 1994 he worked with Jasper Johns as his personal studio assistant.  Continuing his education, he graduated from The Cooper Union with a Bachelor of Fine Arts in 1997.  Jason has been actively curating and showing work for the last several years in the New York metropolitan area.  International opportunities have included a residency and one man show in Prague.  He is currently represented by 31GRAND in New York.  His work has been reviewed in articles appearing in publications including Art in America, World of Art, The New York Times, and The Village Voice. I see my work as an unceasing exploration into the understanding of mortality.  My interest in unique materials helps to develop my ideas of attraction verses repulsion.  I want my work to have both a strong visceral feeling while maintaining a direct cerebral presence.  Jason currently lives and works in Brooklyn, New York. Jason Clay Lewis Email Jason

name: Hell Scientist
description: by DB & Norik DB Mostly known for being somewhat responsible for bringing rave culture and specifically drum & bass to the U.S. in the late 80s. Although he’s made a career in music and done A&R for nearly 20 years, he secretly wishes he was an artist. DJ DB Myspace Norik Between connecting with his scandinavian roots via lutefisk, compulsively checking his Facebook, and playing Mortal Kombat, Norik enjoys adorning people’s torsos with silkscreened mutant cows and rosaries. Apparel design is not Norik’s only fancy. He also enjoys contributing his design abilities to hip music & culture brands, as well as finding a niche in making electronic beats, more specifically drum & bass, which has led to a couple claims to fame in Knowledge magazine and a track signing on Covert Operations. It was also through that very music genre he met DB, everything just fit like legos. Through their twisted ideas, and love of the “weird” and “street”, BBS Gear was born. The Norik
